"My second version of the infamous Battleragers of Faerun, called Kuldjargh's (axe-idiots) by the Dwarves.
It's a fitting name, all-out offense, with little thought for defense. posts.author: Templar
posts.content:
One other thing, when sufficiently drunk (below 0% sobriety) the Barbarian gains a boost to his strength.
1. At first you get a +8 STR bonus and a moderate DEX penalty (5-6 ish?). Upon a second tick, it goes to a +12 STR bonus and a large DEX penalty (-8-10 ish). How bad the DEX penalty is scales with how drunk you are.
2. This DOES count towards the +12 Stat modifier. Meaning while your completely drunk, you won't gain any STR benefits from items, barbarian rage, potions, etc.
Other bits of info... -Depending on how drunk you are, you'll also laugh, fall over, or otherwise flatfoot yourself in the middle of combat. It gets worse/more frequent as you get drunker, but it still happens VERY often even when mildly drunk.

so ya honestly I'm a bit open to other classes or builds. My goals here I'd like to keep to are:
1. Barbarian
2. Ton of Health
3. Ton of damage (with a 2hander of some sort preferred)

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: That sounds good, but don't forget to take Epic Weapon Focus at 21 so that you can take Epic Weapon Specialization. The advantage of Bard over Rogue is that Bards, like Barbarians, also get Taunt as a class skill, so you can make that skill keep updated, but Rogue does get Sneak Attack and Evasion. So if you go Rogue, I suggest Barbarian 15 Fighter 10 Rogue 5 or Fighter 12 Rogue 3, depending on how many feats you want on epics. I also advise you to take 15 barb levels as soon as you can to get Greater Rage. You can go Barb 15 Fighter 5 pre-epic not to lose any BAB, but you will need to survive till lvl 22 without Tumble and UMD dumps, which I don't know if is doable where you play. Also I heard Arelith has a restriction of 3 straight levels of a class, otherwise you could go Barb 16 Fighter 12 Bard 2. You can take bard on levels 21, 22 and 23 and then at 30 to round up the build.

posts.author: johnbonmovi
posts.content: UMD is a necessity for high end play on arelith, if you can't use scrolls or wands you aren't flexible and will be totally dependent on party members to survive. Consumables are everywhere as arelith has lowered the costs of xp and gold to produce them, thus they are quite necessary. Without UMD this build is going to get obliterated by every single epic mob. Can't deathward, can't protect its mind, its dead. Also in pvp you're going to get obliterated by melees who pop true strike wands and kd you.
